lines.content: Current version of Duke allows you to add 3 different types of tasks.
* Represents a deadline in the task list.
* Guarantees: description and time are present and not null.
* Represents an event in the task list.
* Guarantees: description and time are present and not null.
* Returns the status of the current task
* The default status is a cross
* If the task is done it will return a tick
* @return returns a tick or a cross
* Represents a to do in the task list.
* Guarantees: description is present and not null.
* Analyse the user's input and set it as different parts that will be passed to other functions
/** Set any command that is not valid to ERROR */
/** String to separate the time from the whole event command */
/** String to separate the time from the whole deadline command */
* User's input is being analysed and split into different part.
* Split user's input and get the command type.
* Returns the command type given by the user.
* Spilt user's input and get the description of the task if no description
* is specified it will be set to "No description!"
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of" + article + getCommandType() + " cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a " + getCommandType() + " cannot be empty.");
* Returns the description given by the user.
* Spilt user's input and get the time of the task if no task is specified it will be set to "No given time!"
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The time of your " + getCommandType() + " is invalid.");
* Returns the time given by the user.
* Returns true if the user input line is a bye command.
* @return true if the entire user input line is bye
* Returns true if the user input line is a bye command.
* @return true if the entire user input line is list
* Returns true if the user's command type is a done command.
* Returns true if the user's command type is a to do command.
* Returns true if the user's command type is an event command.
* Returns true if the user's command type is a deadline command.
* Returns true if the user's command type is a delete command.
* Returns true if the user's command type is a find command.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye! Hope to see you soon!");
* Represents the file used to store task list data.
* Saves the {@code TaskList} data to the storage file.
public void saveAsTextFile (ArrayList<Task> arrayOfTasks) throws IOException {
* Converts each task to text format that can be saved into the text file.
* @param taskToBeChanged task that has to be converted
* Loads the {@code TaskList} data from this storage file, and then returns it.
* Returns an empty {@code TaskList} if the file does not exist.
* @throws FileNotFoundException if there is no saved text file available
* A list of tasks. Does not allow the description or time of the task to be empty.
private final FileIO savedTextFile = new FileIO(DEFAULT_STORAGE_FILEPATH);
* Retrieve the number of tasks in the list currently.
* @return number of tasks in the list
* Set the number of task in the list.
* Display all current tasks to the user.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Add tasks into the list if it is one of the task commands.
* Return error message if the user command is not any of the command words.
System.out.println("OOPS!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Display what task was added into the list and the number of tasks in the list currently.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + getNumberOfTasks() + " task in the list.");
System.out.println("Now you have " + getNumberOfTasks() + " tasks in the list.");
* Remove the task stated by the user's input
System.out.println("OOPS!!! No such task exists in the list.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Looks like this is an invalid input.");
System.out.println("Please key in your input in the format:");
* Display what task is removed and the number of tasks left in the list currently
System.out.println("Now you have " + getNumberOfTasks() + " task in the list.");
System.out.println("Now you have " + getNumberOfTasks() + " tasks in the list.");
* Set the task stated by the user's input to be done.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Looks like this task is done.");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! No such task exists in the list.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Looks like this is an invalid input.");
System.out.println("Please key in your input in the format:");

System.out.println("OOPS!!! Looks like there is an error saving tasks.");
* Load the saved text file as the current task list.
System.out.println("The file you try to load does not exist!");

* @param keyword word that user want to find in the task list
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
